metadata.title: CVE-2021-3733 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
There's a flaw in urllib's AbstractBasicAuthHandler class. An attacker whocontrols a malicious HTTP server that an HTTP client (such as web browser)connects to, could trigger a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDOS)during an authentication request with a specially crafted payload that issent by the server to the client. The greatest threat that this flaw posesis to application availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.13+esm1').
